messages.subject: book to read- Thank you all so much
messages.msgSnippet: Just wanted to say Thank you to everybody for the information on the books. I am looking forward to spending the winter reading all of them. Thanks again,
messages.messageBody:
Just wanted to say Thank you to everybody for the information on the books. I am looking forward to spending the winter reading all of them.

Thanks again,
Oneida

messages.subject: Re: What is a good unschooling book to read
messages.msgSnippet: ... with, Here s some of my personal favorites: Teach Your Own - John Holt How Children Fail - John Holt Homeschooling Our Children, Unschooling Ourselves -
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "scofield62001"
<scofield62001@...> wrote:


> What is a good unschooling book to read for beginners? It is
> cold and snowing, so I am trying to find a good book to curl up
with,


Here's some of my personal favorites:

Teach Your Own - John Holt
How Children Fail - John Holt

Homeschooling Our Children, Unschooling Ourselves - Allison McKee

Better Than School (I forget the author's name)

A lot of people like The Unprocessed Child by Valerie F. It was okay,
but not as detailed as I would have personally enjoyed.

Jenny
http://beanmommyandthethreebeans.blogspot.com/

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] What is a good unschooling book to read
messages.msgSnippet: _The Unschooling Handbook_ by Mary Griffith. You ll be saying YES, YES, YES!!  Of course this is the way... the whole time! Karen in SD When the power of
messages.messageBody:
_The Unschooling Handbook_ by Mary Griffith.

You'll be saying "YES, YES, YES!! Of course this is the way..." the whole
time!

Karen
in SD


"When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know
peace."
Jimi Hendrix

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] What is a good unschooling book to read
messages.msgSnippet: Rue Kream s book Parenting a Free Child is wonderful. http://www.freechild.info/ The Live and Learn Conference recorded leactures, while not books, are
messages.messageBody:
Rue Kream's book "Parenting a Free Child" is wonderful.
http://www.freechild.info/

The Live and Learn Conference recorded leactures, while not books, are terrific as well.
http://www.liveandlearnconference.org/

Malinda
